transcript.title: Meeting with 20 Leading Australian Businesswomen
transcript.content:
The Prime Minister met today with 20 leading Australian businesswomen whoÂ will be taking part in the Telstra Austral ian-ASEAN Women Leaders Forum inÂ Singapore next week.

The Forum will bring together around 100 of Australia's most influentialÂ businesswomen with counterparts from the ASEAN region inÂ a ground-breaking exercise to extend trade networks.

Mr Keating told representatives of the Australian delegation today that heÂ was confident the Forum would lead to significant trade and other cooperativeÂ ventures between the businesswomen of Australia and from other nations inÂ the Asia Pacific. Notes from the Prime Minister's address are attached.

Minister for Trade, Senator Bob M cMullan, will lead the Australian delegationÂ which includes Deirdr-e Mason from the Telstra Corporation, Jenni Neary fromÂ the GIO, Edith van Dommelen from Woolworths and Susan Ryan from the
Association of Superannuation Funds.

Major female figures from the ASEAN countries Indonesia, Brunei, Malaysia, Â Thailand, the Philippines and Singapore~-will take part, along with severalÂ from Vietnam, Cambodia and the Lao PDR.

Sponsors for the Forum include the Telstra Corporation, AMP, ArthurÂ Andersen, Qantas, the Queensland Investment Corporation, the ANZÂ Banking Group, CRA, McDonalds and Nutri-Metics.

The Telstra Forum has been a cooperative project with financial andÂ organisational support from the Office of the Status of Women, GoldenÂ Marketing, the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, AIDAB and theÂ International Division of the Department of Prime Minister and Cabinet.Â 

14 JulyÂ 1994
